refnamediv.refpurpose: Export Palm Expense application data in a text format.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: read-expenses is used to output the Expense data in a simple text format, which can be used to import into any other application you wish, such as Excel or other application.
If you have expense entries saved on your Palm in the ExpenseDB.pdb file, you can export them to a simple text format, and redirect that to a file/pipe, or STDOUT (the default) using read-expenses.
The output data will resemble something like the following:
refsect1.programlisting: Category: Unfiled Type: 5 Payment: 7 Currency: 23 Amount: 400.00 Vendor: Super Salads City: Westerly Attendees: Joe, Mary, Bob Note: Some simple note text Date: Fri May 9 00:00:00 2004

blockquote.para: Use device file <port> to communicate with the Palm handheld. If this is not specified, read-expenses will look for the $PILOTPORT environment variable. If neither are found or supplied, read-expenses will print the usage information.
